organic_results.title: Socialization via interscholastic athletics: Its effects on delinquency
organic_results.snippet: Male students in a single high school (N= 521) were categorized by type of extracurricular participation: athletics only, service and leadership activities, service-leadership activities and athletics, or no form of extracurricular involvement. Rates of delinquency (from court records) were highest for students who engaged in no extracurricular activities. Rates of delinquency were approximately the same and lower whether athletics or some other form of extracurricular activity occupied the student. Rates were lowest for students in both kinds of …

publication_info.summary: DM Landers, DM Landers - Sociology of Education, 1978 - JSTOR

organic_results.title: Socialization via interscholastic athletics: Its effects on educational attainment
organic_results.snippet: The present study was designed to assess the influence of athletics on educational attainment. It tested Spady's (1970) contention that high school athletes were deficit in the academic skills necessary for later success in college because athletics were their only form of extracurricular involvement. A 1975 Maryland sample (N= 239) and a 1977 Pennsylvania sample (N= 403) of male and female high school students were categorized into athlete-only and athlete-service groups and then compared on Scholastic Aptitude Test (SAT) scores …
